hints.Internal Combustion Engine: This is the heart of the vehicle. It's where fuel is burned to produce power to move the vehicle.
hints.Transmission System: This is responsible for transferring power from the engine to the wheels. It includes the clutch, gearbox, drive shafts, and differentials.
hints.Suspension System: This ensures a smooth ride by absorbing shocks from the road. It also helps to maintain vehicle stability and control.
hints.Brake System: This system slows down or stops the vehicle by converting its kinetic energy into heat energy.
hints.Ignition System: This system provides a spark to ignite the air-fuel mixture in the engine's cylinders.
hints.Fuel System: This system stores and supplies fuel to the engine. It includes the fuel tank, pump, filter, and injectors.
hints.Exhaust System: This system removes and filters out the toxic gases produced during combustion from the engine.
hints.Electrical System: This system powers all electrical devices in the vehicle, including the lights, radio, and ignition system.
hints.Cooling System: This system prevents the engine from overheating by circulating coolant around the engine block.
hints.Air Conditioning System: This system cools, heats, and dehumidifies the air inside the vehicle to maintain a comfortable environment.
hints.Steering System: This system allows the driver to control the direction of the vehicle.
hints.Vehicle Aerodynamics: This is the study of how air flows over the vehicle, which can affect its speed, fuel efficiency, and stability.
hints.Hybrid Technology: This technology combines an internal combustion engine with an electric motor to increase fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.
hints.Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This is a computerized technology that improves vehicle stability by detecting and reducing the loss of traction.
hints.Anti-lock Braking System (ABS): This is a safety system that allows the wheels to maintain tractive contact with the road surface according to driver inputs while braking, preventing the wheels from locking up and avoiding uncontrolled skidding.
